result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Joseph Syverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Joseph Syverson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Joseph Syverson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAYMENT PLAN FOR THIS CASE $50 PER MONTH COMMENCING 12/1/15

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Joseph Syverson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Joseph Syverson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM55, 15CT42, 15TR566, 15TR567
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1 in 15CM55 and Ct 2 in 15CT42.  State will move to dismiss Ct 2 in 15CM55, Ct 1 in 15CT42 and charges in 15TR566 & 15TR567.  Atty Detert agrees.  Defendant enters Guilty plea to Ct 1 in 15CM55 and Ct 2 in 15CT42.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Detert.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM55 & Ct 2 in 15CT42.  Court will dismiss Ct 2 in 15CM55 & Ct 1 in 15CT42 along with charges in 15TR566 & 15TR567.
Arguments by counsel.  Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT:
15CM55 Ct 1:  *Pay fine and costs of $265.60.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

15CT42 Ct 2:  *Serve 45 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber (except first 48 hours), consecutive to any sentence he may be serving.  *Sentence to commence forthwith.  *Granted 4 days credit for time already served.  *Pay fine & costs of $1,694.00.  *24 month DL revocation.  *24 month Ignition Interlock.  *Payment Plan:  $50/month commencing on 12/1/15.  *Payment plan fee of $15.00 to be added.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Syverson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR566 & 567 & 15CT42 & 15CM55 tracking:

15CT42:
Atty Detert states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Detert enters a Not Guilty plea

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set all matters for plea/sentencing
bond continued in all matters.
Bond will also cover 15CT42.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan Joseph Syverson
Current: W1971 Eagle Rd., Neshkoro, WI 54960 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 726 S 30th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Ryan Joseph Syverson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR566 & 15TR567 tracking with:
Atty Hendee states that this was set to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.  Atty Hendee asks for a Return/Pre-trial date.

BY THE COURT:  Set Return & Pretrial
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

DA's Office said the following cases will track together:
15CM55, 15TR566 & 15TR567

Defendant Ryan Joseph Syverson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there may be an OWI - 3rd offense charged at a later date.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond; no special conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 signature bond; no special conditions.
  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get counsel.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
